name: PRIMED GSR Data Model
description: Data model for Genomic Summary Results in the PRIMED consortium

columns.description: unique identifier for a gwas in primed
columns.notes: PRIMED upload workflow would generate this

columns.description: Information about source of GSR data. Include additional details in README
columns.notes: free text short label; useful for unreleased GSR

columns.description: URL of source (if applicable)
Study accession identifier for GSR downloaded from GWAS Catalog
columns.notes: identifier in GCSTXXXXXX format

columns.description: Analysis accession identifier for GSR downloaded from dbGaP
columns.notes: identifier in phaXXXXXX.v format

columns.description: Pubmed ID identifier of the publication reporting the GWAS
columns.notes: PMID identifier

columns.description: Last name and initials of the first author
External link to the publication
columns.notes: URL of publication

columns.description: Date on which the GWAS was released publicy
columns.notes: e.g. on dbGaP or GWAS Catalog

columns.description: consent abbreviation (https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC4721915/table/pgen.1005772.t001/?report=objectonly)
columns.notes: NRES is the code for no restrictions on data use (i.e. open access)

columns.description: Date GSR was uploaded to PRIMED AnVIL workspace
columns.notes: YYYY-MM-DD format

columns.description: email of the PRIMED contributor who can be contacted for data related questions
columns.notes: recommended by WG. helpful when GSR is not publicly released and is from a Biobank or some other source

columns.description: reported trait
columns.notes: free text trait name

columns.description: type of trait
columns.notes: determines which columns we need to check for in the data file

columns.description: unit of measurement for the reported trait (before transformation)
columns.notes: Report unit as something like 'binary',  'indicator', or 'categorical'  for non-quantitative traits

columns.description: transformation applied to the reported trait
columns.examples: none, log, inverse normal, winsorization, standardization, other
columns.notes: put 'none' if no transformation applied

columns.description: a brief description of how the trait was measured or defined; additional details can be provided in the README
columns.notes: e.g. ICD codes used to identify cases/phenotypes in EHR data

columns.description: Covariates included in the association analysis for trait adjustment
columns.notes: put 'none' if no covariates

columns.description: concept_id for trait from OMOP concept table
columns.notes: discuss in PRIMED phenotype WG

columns.description: Experimental Factor Ontology (EFO) term the trait was mapped to
columns.notes: mapped_trait value used in GWAS Catalog

columns.description: Reference genome assembly that the submitted data is mapped to
dbSNP build for the rsIDS included in GSR files
Total number of variants in the analysis results across all chromosomes
columns.notes: This will be used for a QC step to check data integrity of submitted data

columns.description: minimum minor allele frequency filter
minimum minor allele count filter
The genotyping technology used for detecting variants
Genotyping platform description including manufacturer, array name, sequencer name
columns.notes: put 'unavailable' if unknown

columns.description: Indicator of whether the analysis was performed using imputed genotypes or dosages
Reference panel use for imputation
columns.notes: Put 'Other' if not one of the common reference panels listed. Can include further information in imputation_reference_panel_detail or README

columns.description: Details of the imputation reference panel; e.g. version number or name of panel when imputation_reference_panel = 'Other'
columns.notes: version number or name of 'other' include N/A

columns.description: minimum imputation quality value (e.g. Rsq, info) for filtering imputed variants
columns.notes: If no filter, enter value of 0

columns.description: Total sample size in the analysis
columns.notes: When different markers have different sample sizes, e.g, due to missing genotypes, use max sample size across markers

columns.description: Number of cases
columns.notes: When different markers have different sample sizes, e.g, due to missing genotypes, use max number of cases across markers

columns.description: Number of controls
columns.notes: When different markers have different sample sizes, e.g, due to missing genotypes, use max number of controls across markers

columns.description: effective sample size = n_samp for quantitative traits  = 4/(1/n_case + 1/n_ctrl) for binary traits
columns.notes: When different markers have different sample sizes, e.g, due to missing genotypes, use max sample size across markers

columns.description: proportion of female participants
mean age of study participants
median age of study participants
minimum age of study participants
maximum age of study participants
mean age of study cases
median age of study cases
minimum age of study cases
maximum age of study cases
mean age of study controls
median age of study controls
minimum age of study controls
maximum age of study controls
A list of cohorts that collected the samples.
Is the analysis a meta-analysis? Include additional details (e.g. what groups comprised the meta-analysis) in README
the concept or classification scheme used to categorize people into populations for this analysis
name given to a population that describes or classifies it according to the dimension along which it was identified
columns.examples: Chinese Americans | European Americans | African Americans

columns.description: proportion of participants from each population in the same order mapping to the values in the population_labels variable
Reported countries of recruitment
Reported countries of birth
The name or description of the method or computational algorithm used for GWAS.
The name of the software used for the GWAS

columns.notes: AnVIL requires entity id with naming convention <table_name>_id

columns.description: A valid md5 checksum
columns.notes: (32-digit hexadecimal number)

columns.description: unique identifier for a gwas in primed
columns.notes: AnVIL upload workflow would generate this

columns.description: File path in cloud storage
Type of the file
chromosome included in the GSR data file
columns.notes: 'None' for data dictionary or README files

columns.description: Count of variants in the GSR data file
columns.notes: Leave blank for data dictionary or README files

columns.description: chr:pos:ref:alt
the chromosome that the variant is located on
columns.notes: confirm the enumerations with WG

columns.description: the base pair location of the variant
rs Identifier
DNA strand designation
effect allele of the variant
columns.notes: allow for I/D as enum and QC

columns.description: the other allele to the effect allele
columns.notes: allow for I/D as enum and QC

columns.description: reference allele
alternate allele
effect allele frequency of the variant
effect allele frequency in cases for binary traits
effect allele frequency in controls for binary traits
minor allele count
p-value
negative log10 of p-value
estimated effect size
columns.notes: reported on log odds scale for binary traits

columns.description: standard error of beta
95% confidence interval lower bound for beta
95% confidence interval upper bound for beta
odds ratio for binary traits
95% confidence interval lower bound for OR
95% confidence interval upper bound for OR
direction of effect
sample size
columns.notes: Optional. If it's the same value for all variants then not necessary to include (since captured in the analysis table). If values differ across variants, then encouraged to include.

columns.description: number of cases for binary traits
columns.notes: Optional. If it's the same value for all variants then not necessary to include (since captured in the analysis table). If values differ across variants, then encouraged to include.

columns.description: number of controls for binary traits
columns.notes: Optional. If it's the same value for all variants then not necessary to include (since captured in the analysis table). If values differ across variants, then encouraged to include.

columns.description: effective sample size = n_samp for quantitative traits = 4/(1/n_case + 1/n_ctrl) for binary traits
columns.notes: Optional. If it's the same value for all variants then not necessary to include (since captured in the analysis table). If values differ across variants, then encouraged to include.

columns.description: logical for whether or not the variant is imputed
imputation quality score for an imputed variant
columns.notes: Description of the score will be provided in data dictionary

columns.description: p-value for test of effect size heterogeneity
heterogeneity I^2 statistic value
